_description: Pet Insurance Sample Data - Use this template for creating pet insurance pages

data.intro_content: Pet insurance helps manage unexpected veterinary costs. California pet owners pay an average of $45/month for comprehensive coverage.
data.requirements_content: Pet insurance has no state mandates, but waiting periods apply for coverage. Most plans don't cover pre-existing conditions.

cost_factors.description: Older pets cost more to insure
Some breeds have higher health risks
Urban areas have higher vet costs

faqs.question: What does pet insurance cover?
faqs.answer: Most plans cover accidents, illnesses, and some offer wellness coverage for routine care.

faqs.question: Are pre-existing conditions covered?
faqs.answer: No, pre-existing conditions are typically excluded. Enroll your pet when they're young and healthy.
